title: Rafi0001
author: Rafi0001
content: Please i have a few question on the merits systemIs it possible for a user as a newbie to send merits?If yes, How many?and how many can you receive as a Newbie?

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Your account is getting old already, I am surprised that you do not know about the merit system, or are you trolling?Quote from: Rafi0001 on August 25, 2022, 07:25:40 AMIs it possible for a user as a newbie to send merits?YesQuote from: Rafi0001 on August 25, 2022, 07:25:40 AMIf yes, How many?Maximum of 50 to any user per monthQuote from: Rafi0001 on August 25, 2022, 07:25:40 AMand how many can you receive as a Newbie?Maximum of 50 from the same user per month. You can receive as many as possible because different people can send merit to you, but max of 50 from the same user. Read about merit system here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2818350.0At top right corner of each post, you will see quote, beside quote you will see merit, click on it if you want to merit the post.

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: I believe you know that you need one merit at least to rank up and earn more stakes for your bounty work.This topic is bad try to earn one merit.It is essy to get one if you contribute to forum discussions, help others rather than spend one or two minutes to create this merit begging topic.For all your questions, Charles answered but I think you already knew it.

comments.author: Falconer
comments.body: Quote from: Rafi0001 on August 25, 2022, 07:25:40 AMIs it possible for a user as a newbie to send merits?You can, especially when you have at least 1 sMerit. See this section: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=merit. Every time you get 2 merit, then you can spend 1 sMerit for other users.QuoteIf yes, How many?50 merit/ user within 30 days. This means if you have 1000 sMerit then you can spend it on 20 different users.Quoteand how many can you receive as a Newbie?There is no limit to the amount you receive if it comes from different users. The rule is that you can only receive and send 50 merit in 30 days from or to different users. This cycle will repeat for the next month, and I think that's how the system works.Quote from: hd49728 on August 25, 2022, 07:35:42 AMI believe you know that you need one merit at least to rank up and earn more stakes for your bounty work.I just realized about that.

Or you didn't concentrate much on the question? If I'm not mistaken, he mean as a newbie can you give out merit to another user? I think one must have sMerit in order to send merit. So I'm little bit confused seeing you saying yes and getting more lost when the above me justify the answer you gave to OP. I need more enlightenment please.edited I understand now. comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: You have registered on the forum 223 days and have made 182 posts till the time and only 2 out of them are in B&H help board asking for image doubt and second one this merit related and all other 10 pages are filled with your bounty submission reports which are not merit worthy so how do you think you will get them on the forum if you have not contributed well enough?There is only limit on sending smerits which is 50 to one member in one month but if you are not merit source then you will have to earn double the amount of merits.There is no limit on earning merits but it all depends on how useful your post were on the forum members or if they started healthy discussion on the forum but you are not on that list still.When merit system was introduced by @theymos back in 2018 it was to reduce the spam and shit posters restricting them to rank up on forum and it has helped a lot but if you focus more on acquiring knowledge then it would help rather then asking how to earn merits on the forum.You have spend quite a time on forum and stiil newbie but if you decide to learn you will see outcomes.
